name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Pier Point Inn

reviews.text: There was nothing particularly great nor negative about this property, but for being neither an upscale nor a boutique hotel, it doesn't seem worth it's $150 avg. room rate.
reviews.title: It was fine, but overpriced for what it is.

reviews.text: Service was nice, the free breakfast was akin to a Holiday Inn Express or other similar property, with the waffle maker and cereal, etc. I just expected to be wowed, and we were not.
reviews.title: Great Time Had by All

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at this hotel based on the reviews I saw on TripAdvisor. We have 3 kids (5, 12 and 15 years old) and we stayed for 2 days. We stayed in 1 of the 2 suites they have at the hotel. The room was very roomy and homey. The indoor pool and spa were clean, breakfast was yummy, etc. I can't say enough about the receptionists at the front desk - they were wonderful. We were offered warm, fresh-baked chocolate chip cookies each afternoon and they also had free internet service. We enjoyed our stay very much!!!!!
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay, wonderfull staff, great breakfast bar , excellent customer service !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great customer service, we all slept well in there comfortable beds. We ate at there breakfast bar it was all so wonderfull.
reviews.title: Great location & view on mouth of river, great service & breakfast.

reviews.text: The beds were very comfortable. Great front counter service from Aliitasi Tupua. Best continental breakfast of any motel we've stayed at in a long time.
reviews.title: Great room, staff, I will be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited in late Septemeber and the hotel was in need of some work. Our 1st room had a slanted floor so the 2nd room was at least level. Throughout the night the plumbing from the room above made the pipes vibrate every time someone ran water or flushed the toilet. It sounded as though we had our own personal water fall in our room.
reviews.title: Skip The Best Western in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The linens were worn and in need of replacement. The carpets felt like soap residue. This hotel really needs some rennovation. Be careful of which room you get, the road noise can be a problem.
reviews.title: UGH - Don't Bother

reviews.text: Reserved a pet-friendly room 5 weeks in advance; arrived to find our $250/night deluxe King had been rented to another party as we were told "you did not reserve a pet-friendly room" WRONG. We were given a HORRIBLE double room with strong urine odor, no hot water, and no phone (for $230/night no less). Complained and was given a Queen room without a screen door on the sliding doors, and no working lights on one side of the room. The second day our key card quit working and we had to ask the front desk to reactivate it for our last day. At least this room smelled better. There was mold around both shower ceilings and the overall quality of these rooms are not worth the price which is higher than most nicer and newer hotels in this area. What a disappointing Anniversary gift - we really thought $250/night was getting us a resort-quality hotel. PS - the full breakfast with the room fee is not worth bothering - rubber eggs and watered down apple juice-ugh.
reviews.title: gorgeous spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location overlooking the river. Having a balcony was great. The room was very nice, comfy and clean with nice amenities. My only complaint is that the room was not made up by the time we returned in the afternoon.
reviews.title: More like a Motel Six

reviews.text: We stayed for two days with one small dog. The first room we were assigned to had a horrible odor masked by some type of odor powder which was actually on the floor, door, etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to Stay!!!!

reviews.text: As soon as we entered the lobby we were greeted by friendly staff, and experienced this thru-out our stay. It was not overboard but enough to make us feel like we were welcomed and important. The lobby/dining room was very clean and had a very warm feeling to it. Once we checked into our room, we were pleased to find it was quite roomy. A nice flat-screen tv, comfortable beds, clean room, and a wonderful view of the Bay. Hot and Cold breakfast was available in the morning as well as juice and coffee. We enjoyed the pool and hot tubs, although we didn't try the sauna. I have already told a few of my friends about this place and we are planning on returning this summer. If you are in Florence you should check this place out, I really enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: We were very impressed with the friendly staff, great room, and beautiful view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room was beautiful, the breakfast was good the staff was nice, the price was right. But, it smelled so bad! I had trouble sleeping because our room had a strong smell o dirty laundry. the shower was also full of hair that was not ours! Yuck! The best was very comffy also, just with smelly lines. Too bad not sure if we would ever stay again. Would reccomend just becasue there are so few hotels in florence and maybe we just got a bad room!
reviews.title: beautiful and smelly!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wifes birthday is December 23rd and therefore I always try and do something a little special. We had just returned from Africa 2 weeks earlier so a "Big" trip somewhere was out of the question. A friend suggested we travel up the Oregon Coast and stay the night in Florence. We had never done that and decided it would be a nice mellow evening. Our usual accommodation's range from upscale boutique style hotels to sleeping on a mud hut somewhere in the Jungle so we are quite open... however we usually try and avoid the "Big Chain" type hotels due to the usual drab stylings and generic feel.
reviews.title: A Birthday to remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were quite surprised and genuinely THRILLED when we entered our room at the Pier Point Best Western. The furnishings looked new, they leather sofas and chairs, flat screen HD TV, it appeared there had been a recent remodel and so everything was up to date. The room was HUGE with an amazing view of the river looking across to Old Town Florence. It was not what we expected from a chain hotel. Also... the (heated) pool area was very well set up with a Cabana type feel complete with Umbrellas and chairs, very inviting, in fact we considered not leaving the hotel that night for dinner. In fact, we did just walk across the bridge into Old Town (nice location considering we enjoy drinking wine) and had a fabulous dinner (cant remember the name) in a small Italian restaurant complete with a duo signing Bohemian French songs with the entire restaurant joining in.
reviews.title: Spotlessly clean
Peaceful lovely place to stay on the waterfront across from old town Florence
reviews.text: All in all, I remember the look on my wifes face was full of Joy as we celebrated her 41st Birthday.

This is the nicest Best Western, ever! the bathrooms had granite and a nice shower head. Great mattress. Carpet was not grimy looking. I was concerned that the rooms would have too much road noise as it's located kind of below grade off Highwah 101, but the rooms were quiet.. at least my room was! i had a room that did not have neighbors on anyside. My colleagues staying in other parts of the hotel report hearing voices thru the walls and a 20 degree slant in the floors. I can see how staying on upper floors would be a pain because there are no elevators and you would have to haul your suitcase up multiple stairs.
reviews.title: Nice surprise

likes.liked: — Friendly front desk staff, free breakfast, free wifi, good cable channels
likes.disliked: — not located directly IN Old Town Florence, so you have to drive to get anything to eat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great. Loved the make your own Belgian waffle machines.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Awesome Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk staff was really nice and remembered everyone's names.
reviews.title: not your average best western!

likes.liked: — The bed, cleanliness and the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good wifi and good selection of cable channels.
reviews.title: The best Best Western.

reviews.text: The location is gorgeous, staff was helpful, and free breakfast every morning was a nice bonus. I had originally stayed at this property back in 2003 and while acceptable it was nothing to write home about. What a difference the renovations have made. We were so pleased to find much of the hotel and grounds had been updated. I think it may have new ownership now, it shows! Not sure what other reviewers were saying about tilting rooms...our was perfect and the bed really comfortable too. Try to get a room with a balcony overlooking the river - lovely view. We'll be back. The beach was less than 10 minutes away & don't miss the Sea Lion Caves.
reviews.title: Nightmare

aka: Best Western Plus Pier Point Hotel
